attributes.action: CJS only recognise ‘autism’ to enable criminal prosecutions to continue.
attributes.additional_details: If CJS recognises ‘autism’ fully and our vulnerabilities living within a NT society then many future ASD lives will not be destroyed and would avoid prison / psychiatric units by considerable less financial resources being re-directed towards ‘proactive support’ rather than the current system of ‘reactive support’ although this is ONLY given after a S37 very little support is given after prison and S117 support is reduced/withdrawn over a 12 month period due to a lack of funds in local authorities
attributes.background: Parliament must take immediate action to ensure CJS recognises if a ASD person is given sufficient support, guidance and protection then the criminal act would never have been committed - how can a vulnerable ASD person understand/deal with NT’s who control/manipulate them?

rejection.details:
We understand that you care about support for people with autism, but we're not exactly sure what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government and Parliament to do. If you would like some help with this, please contact us at petitionsteam@parliament.uk 

You can find more information on the treatment of adults with autism by the criminal justice system here: 
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cdp-2018-

You may wish to sign these petitions about support for people with autism: 

Fund organisations that provide support & therapy for children/adults with SEN: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/329876

Fund Autistic Support Services for Adults in every city: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331220
